SourcedStatement: According to Mayor London Breed, the intention is to clean up sidewalks and force unhoused people into the city’s labyrinthine network of shelter and supportive housing programs.
Name: Mayor London Breed

SourcedStatement: A federal survey released in May counted more than 8,000 unhoused people in the city, which has fewer than 4,000 shelter beds to offer.
Name: null

SourcedStatement: Gordon said claims for lost property can be filed with the City Attorney's office.

SourcedStatement: Mayor Breed's office did not respond to requests for comment.

SourcedStatement: In order to bring public attention to the moral question of sweeps, the Coalition on Homelessness and other unhoused advocates planned to crash an encampment sweep in SoMa last Thursday, which had been scheduled for 12:30 p.m.
Name: Coalition on Homelessness

SourcedStatement: The group planned live performances, speeches, and outreach, to take place at the same time as SFPD and Department of Public Works enforcement.
Name: SFPD and Department of Public Works

SourcedStatement: There were 178 people on the Department of Homelessness and Supportive Housing’s online waitlist for shelter on Monday afternoon.
Name: Department of Homelessness and Supportive Housing

SourcedStatement: On a grey Thursday morning last week, Antonio Robinson watched as a coterie of cops, workers from the city Department of Public Works, and a pair of outreach specialists descended on his tent.
Name: Antonio Robinson
Title: null
Justification: The 38-year-old had chosen to set up camp near Palou Ave. and Griffith St. in Hunters Point, on a dead-end road surrounded by industrial buildings.

SourcedStatement: Robinson’s last encampment was swept about a month ago, and “nearly everything” was taken, including his state ID card, he said.

Title: null
Justification: The 38-year-old had chosen to set up camp near Palou Ave. and Griffith St. in Hunters Point, on a dead-end road surrounded by industrial buildings.

SourcedStatement: Joey O’Brien, 46, tried to explain to police officers that he was camping on the sidewalk in Hunters Point while investigating a homicide that occurred while he was in jail.
Name: Joey O’Brien
Title: null

SourcedStatement: “I don’t understand,” O’Brien kept repeating.
Name: Joey O’Brien
Title: null

SourcedStatement: O’Brien was polite and contrite, admitting that he had broken several windows in the past while suffering a mental breakdown.
Name: Joey O’Brien
Title: null

SourcedStatement: In a response to Gazetteer's questions about potential breaches in protocol, Public Works spokesperson Rachel Gordon only noted that "the policy clearly spells out how soiled items can be handled and our crews follow the policy and consistently apply its terms."
Name: Rachel Gordon
Title: spokesperson

SourcedStatement: Gordon said claims for lost property can be filed with the City Attorney's office.
Name: Rachel Gordon
Title: spokesperson

SourcedStatement: Instead, the city swooped down on the encampments at Sixth and Jessie streets earlier than scheduled, said Julian Highsmith, communications and policy director for the Coalition on Homelessness.
Name: Julian Highsmith
Title: communications and policy director
Justification: communications and policy director for the Coalition on Homelessness

SourcedStatement: “Typically, with city sweeps, they give 72 hours of notice with location and time, and we were following that, but they didn’t follow that usual rule,” Highsmith said.
Name: Julian Highsmith
Title: communications and policy director
Justification: communications and policy director for the Coalition on Homelessness

SourcedStatement: Highsmith told Gazetteer he believes the city may have gotten wind of the group’s planned sweep disruption and undercut it in order to prevent unhoused people from organizing with their advocates during an enforcement.
Name: Julian Highsmith
Title: communications and policy director
Justification: communications and policy director for the Coalition on Homelessness

SourcedStatement: “I personally think it’s a little suspicious to do the sweep earlier.
Name: Julian Highsmith
Title: communications and policy director
Justification: communications and policy director for the Coalition on Homelessness

SourcedStatement: It doesn’t seem like the city wants attention on the encampment sweeps, and I don’t think they want people to see what happens during that process,” he said.
Name: Julian Highsmith
Title: communications and policy director

SourcedStatement: Between December 2022 and June of this year, a federal injunction prevented the city from penalizing people for sleeping on public property without an alternative offer for shelter.
Name: null

SourcedStatement: But in June, the Supreme Court green-lit such penalties, prompting Gov. Gavin Newsom to order California city officials to “move urgently” to clear illegal encampments around the state.
Name: null

SourcedStatement: According to Public Works policy, staff are supposed to provide the resident of an encampment a “reasonable amount of time (approximately 30 minutes)” to sort through and collect their belongings before the camp is torn down.
Name: Public Works

SourcedStatement: Despite promises from law enforcement and city officials that this property will be preserved, there is plenty of evidence that the city’s hasty process of clearing encampments has left people without immediate access to essential supplies and equipment; as a recent batch of public records secured by City Hall watchdog Hazel Williams shows, Public Works has bagged medications, wheelchairs, and even a mobility walker from unhoused people, taking them to the city’s storage facility on Cesar Chavez St.
Name: null
Justification: a recent batch of public records secured by City Hall watchdog Hazel Williams

SourcedStatement: As it turned out, O’Brien had a warrant for failing to appear for a previous court date.
Name: null

SourcedStatement: More than anything, however, he begged for officers to bring over his two neat backpacks, which had his best clothes, documents, and “bits of silver.”
Name: officers

SourcedStatement: Public Works employees began examining and collecting O’Brien’s possessions as soon as he was detained, without giving him the sorting time required by policy.
Name: Public Works employees

SourcedStatement: Eventually, an officer brought a black backpack to O’Brien, but gestured to the truck, now indiscriminately piled high with his property.
Name: officer

SourcedStatement: “The other stuff is under all that over there,” the officer said with a shrug.
Name: officer

SourcedStatement: “You’re going to have to pick it up later.”
Name: officer

SourcedStatement: Despite promises from law enforcement and city officials that this property will be preserved, there is plenty of evidence that the city’s hasty process of clearing encampments has left people without immediate access to essential supplies and equipment; as a recent batch of public records secured by City Hall watchdog Hazel Williams shows, Public Works has bagged medications, wheelchairs, and even a mobility walker from unhoused people, taking them to the city’s storage facility on Cesar Chavez St.
Name: law enforcement and city officials

SourcedStatement: Many unhoused people, including Robinson, say it can be challenging to identify and retrieve their belongings at the facility.
Name: unhoused people

SourcedStatement: When they succeed, they often find important pieces missing from their stash — a problem that has persisted over years of sweeps.
Name: unhoused people

SourcedStatement: Instead, a small group of protesters regrouped at City Hall for a series of chants and short speeches, holding a symbolic police citation for Breed that accused her of violating human rights.
Name: protesters

SourcedStatement: Dozens of people lined the sidewalks that had been swept just hours prior, fussing with their belongings, setting up new tents, and discreetly selling wares to one another.
Name: people
